Fun Fact: Schools of sardines can be miles long and are often visible from an airplane
Estimated Population Size: Pacific Sardine population is measured at 27,547 metric tons
Most Distinctive Feature: Silver color and one small dorsal fin
Habitat: Saltwater oceans and seas around the world
Predators: Dolphins, seals, penguins, sharks, terns, pelicans
Common Name: European Pilchard, Pacific Sardine, South American Pilchard
Name: Sardines
